[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Integration] [Type Tag Import] When MoveFunctionCall ty_args are processed, can malicious type tags bypass Move's type system constraints? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Integration] [Module Resolution] Can MoveFunctionCall reference modules not in LOADED_MODULES, causing null pointer dereference or undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Integration] [Function Signature Mismatch] Can MoveFunctionCall args count differ from the actual function signature, causing stack corruption during execution? (Critical)
[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Integration] [Generic Instantiation] Can ty_args contain type parameters that violate generic constraints, causing type safety violations? (High)

[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Builder Integration] [Locals Overflow] When PreviousResult indices are resolved, can the total number of locals exceed u8::MAX, causing bytecode generation to fail or use incorrect indices? (High)

[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Builder Integration] [Parameter Count] Can the combination of signers and raw arguments exceed Move's parameter limit, causing execution failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Builder Integration] [Return Value Tracking] Is return_idx properly validated against the actual number of return values, or can it reference non-existent returns? (High)

[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Decompiler Integration] [Bytecode Injection] Can generate_batched_call_payload be exploited by providing non-composer scripts that are misinterpreted as composer scripts? (High)

[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Decompiler Integration] [Metadata Manipulation] Can scripts with modified APTOS_SCRIPT_COMPOSER_KEY metadata bypass version checking and cause vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Decompiler Integration] [OpCode Sequence] Can unusual bytecode opcode sequences cause the decompiler to reconstruct incorrect CallArgument sequences? (High)
[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Edge Case] [Empty Arguments] Can MoveFunctionCall with empty args Vec call functions expecting parameters, causing undefined behavior? (Medium)
[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Edge Case] [Empty Type Arguments] Can MoveFunctionCall with empty ty_args call generic functions, causing type inference failures? (Medium)
[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Edge Case] [Zero Signers] Can multi_signer(0) create a composer with no signers, violating transaction requirements? (High)
[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Edge Case] [Max U16 Values] Can call_idx or return_idx being u16::MAX cause integer overflow in arithmetic operations? (High)

[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Edge Case] [Argument Operation on Signer] Can borrow(), copy(), or borrow_mut() be meaningfully applied to CallArgument::Signer, or do they return errors that might be mishandled? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Thread Safety] [WASM Single Thread] Are there assumptions about single-threaded WASM execution that could be violated in multi-threaded Rust contexts? (Medium)
[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Thread Safety] [Shared State] Can PreviousResult references become invalid if the underlying call list is modified concurrently? (High)

[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Gas Metering] [Nested Calls] Can deeply nested PreviousResult chains (call referencing call referencing call...) cause excessive gas consumption or stack exhaustion? (Medium)
[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Resource Exhaustion] [Large Type Arguments] Can ty_args contain excessively large or complex types causing memory exhaustion during processing? (Medium)
[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Resource Exhaustion] [Vector Growth] Can args Vec in MoveFunctionCall grow unboundedly, causing memory exhaustion? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Access Control] [Signer Substitution] Can an attacker craft CallArgument::Signer with index pointing to a more privileged signer in a multi-agent transaction? (Critical)
[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Access Control] [Module Access] Can MoveFunctionCall access system modules or functions that should be restricted? (Critical)
[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Access Control] [Resource Access] Can PreviousResult references access resources owned by other accounts through type confusion? (Critical)
[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [State Consistency] [Operation Type Mutation] If ArgumentOperation changes between borrow and actual use, can this cause inconsistent state? (High)

[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [State Consistency] [Call Order] Can reordering MoveFunctionCalls in the sequence cause different results than intended, breaking transaction semantics? (High)
